commitResults.messageTitle: Added Eva.java file for level 0
commitResults.messageBody: I made a new file called Eva.java for my chatbot named Eva and coded it to greet and exit

commitResults.messageTitle: Update code according to the requirements of level 1: Echo
commitResults.messageBody: Add lines in between the texts to increase readibility. Add while loop to echo messages.

commitResults.messageTitle: Add code for level 3
commitResults.messageBody:
Created an array of size 100 for list.
Add String into array when scanned.
Iterate the list and print out in bullet points when user type list.

commitResults.messageTitle: Add code for level 2
commitResults.messageBody:
Created an array of size 100 for list.
Add String into array when scanned.
Iterate the list and print out in bullet points when user type list.

commitResults.messageTitle: Add Task.java and update code according to requirements of level 3
commitResults.messageBody:
I created class Task as recommeded in the question.

For the code in Eva.java, I added a few more if branches to account for the mark and unmark feature.
I created helper functions to increase the readibility of the main code.

commitResults.messageTitle: Update code to tweak the code to follow coding standards
commitResults.messageBody: I changed markAsDone() function name to setMarkAsDone() as it is a setter function.

commitResults.messageTitle: Add Deadline.java class file
commitResults.messageBody:
Class Deadline is an inheritance of Task.
Deadline has an additional by variable which is used to keep track of the duedates.

commitResults.messageTitle: Add Todo.java
commitResults.messageBody:
Todo is an inheritance of Task.
There is a toString() function that overrides to display the additional [T].

commitResults.messageTitle: Add Event.java
commitResults.messageBody:
Event is an inheritance of Task.
It contains 2 additional variables 'from' and 'to' to keep track of the time period of the event.

commitResults.messageTitle: Update Eva.java
commitResults.messageBody:
A new toString() function is added to print the [ ] out.
With this function, its subclass can override this to print their own version.

commitResults.messageTitle: Update code according to requirements of level 4
commitResults.messageBody:
I changes the if-else branches to switch branch to increase readability.
Added new cases for todo, deadline, event and their respective functions.
Changed the names from markTaskAsDone to markTask to increase readability as it is shorter.

commitResults.messageTitle: Add TaskManager.java
commitResults.messageBody:
Moved task handling logic (add, mark, unmark, list) from the main loop to this new TaskManager class.
This class is also incharge of the printing of tasks, todos, deadlines and events.
This change simplifies the code in main.

commitResults.messageTitle: Update main code to simplify it
commitResults.messageBody:
Created a new class called TaskManager and shift all the task handling logic to the new class.
This shortens and simplifies the main method, increasing its readability.
Also removed magic numbers.

commitResults.messageTitle: Add EvaException.java to handle exceptions
Update Eva.java to handle exceptions
commitResults.messageBody:
Updated to handle the situation where the user type in an unknown
command (not todo, deadline, event, mark etc)

Previously, if user type something, it will return added: (something)
Removed it as this feature (level 2) is no longer relevant and it
does not make sense with the exception mentioned above.

commitResults.messageTitle: Update code to handle other exceptions
commitResults.messageBody:
The errors that are being handled are:
*missing descriptions in todo, deadline and event
*missing by in deadline
*missing from and to in event

When the exceptions are called, a message will be shown to guide
users to enter in the correct format

commitResults.messageTitle: Update exception handling for markTask and unmarkTask
commitResults.messageBody:
It handles case where the task number is out of range and prompts
users to input a valid task number if an error occurs

commitResults.messageTitle: Merge branch 'branch-Level-5'
Change tasks from array to ArrayList
Update code for delete feature
commitResults.messageBody:
- Implemented deleteTask method to allow users to delete tasks by task
number
- Ensured that task number validation is performed, with appropriate
error handling using EvaException.
- After deletion, the task count is updated and a confirmation message
is printed along with the remaining number of tasks.

commitResults.messageTitle: Add saveTasksToFile method for file saving
commitResults.messageBody:
-Creates "data" directory if it does not exists
-Add exception handling for potential IO errors

commitResults.messageTitle: Add loadTasksFromFile method for file saving
commitResults.messageBody: Implement method to load tasks from file

commitResults.messageTitle: Add parseTaskFromString method for file saving
commitResults.messageBody:
Add task parsing logic to convert string input into objects based
on task type

commitResults.messageTitle: Update code for level 6 and level 7
commitResults.messageBody: Allows for file saving and deletion of tasks

commitResults.messageTitle: Merge branch 'branch-Level-6'
Merge branch 'branch-Level-7'
commitResults.messageBody:
# Conflicts:
#	src/main/java/TaskManager.java

commitResults.messageTitle: Implement Storage class file
commitResults.messageBody: Moved the file save management from TaskManager to Storage

commitResults.messageTitle: Update TaskManager to implement Storage class
Update Storage to remove a bug
commitResults.messageBody:
Added trim() functions.
Previously, when recovering the saved data and printing it out, there
will be extra spaces. For example, originally it was 1. [T][ ] code, it
will become 1. [T][ ]  code, with an extra space.

commitResults.messageTitle: Implement Ui class
commitResults.messageBody: Responsible with the interactions with the user.

commitResults.messageTitle: Update Eva.java with Ui class
commitResults.messageBody: Allows the code to be more concise and readable

commitResults.messageTitle: Update TaskManager.java with Ui class
commitResults.messageBody:
- Changed all the System.out.println with ui.showMessage.
- This allows Ui class to only handle the interactions between the
user

commitResults.messageTitle: Implement CommandHandler and Parser class file
commitResults.messageBody:
CommandHandler is responsible for executing commands by invoking
relevant methods from TaskManager

Parser is responsible for parsing the command and extracting arguments
from the input string

commitResults.messageTitle: Simplify code in Eva.java
commitResults.messageBody:
Eva.java is simplified to only handling the starting of program and
ending of program.
This makes the main code shorter and improves readability

commitResults.messageTitle: Update to reduce the responsibilities of TaskManager
commitResults.messageBody:
Previously, TaskManager was parsing and doing complex logics like
todos, events and deadlines.
Now, with Parser class, the parsing responsibles are moved to Parser
class allowing TaskManager to only handle task related responsibilities

commitResults.messageTitle: Update CommandHandler to include case "find"
Update Parser to parse find inputs
Add contains method in Task
commitResults.messageBody: contains will check if a description contains a word

commitResults.messageTitle: Update TaskManager to add find operator
commitResults.messageBody:
- findTasks will find if a specific word is in the list
- If there is, it will print out the tasks with that word
- If not, it will print a message out

commitResults.messageTitle: Change contains to isContain
commitResults.messageBody: To make the boolean method sound like a boolean

commitResults.messageTitle: Update TaskManager to remove an unnecessary method
commitResults.messageBody:
- Removed extractDigit because the parsing logic is already done in
Parser class
- As parseArguments in Parser class return String[], it is required
to use Interger.parseInt to convert from String to int

commitResults.messageTitle: Add JavaDoc to the classes and methods
Change the names of some methods
commitResults.messageBody:
Decided to change printTodo, printDeadline, printEvent to addTodo,
addDeadline, addEvent because the methods is about adding those task
into tasklist. So print is not an accurate representation of the
method.

commitResults.messageTitle: Add user guide to README.md
Add new methods to Ui.java
commitResults.messageBody:
These methods are responsible in dealing the Ui with users.
Initially, this is in the methods in TaskManager which is
inappropriate as methods in TaskManager show deal with logics
regarding commands/tasks.

commitResults.messageTitle: Update code for TaskManager.java
commitResults.messageBody:
- Simplify TaskManger to handle task management only
- This also increases readability

commitResults.messageTitle: Update exception code to make it concise
commitResults.messageBody:
- Notice the same exception code repeating in different methods
- Extract it out and create new method in EvaException
- Makes code more readable

commitResults.messageTitle: Add javadoc for new methods in Ui.java and EvaException.java
Update Storage.java to ensure tasks stay marked
commitResults.messageBody:
Initially, when tasks are marked. After exiting the program and
coming back, the marked tasks would not stay marked
